newsArray.title: Punjab Kings' star breaks Rohit Sharma's fastest T20I century record during World Cup qualifier
newsArray.description: The star cricketer Sikandar Raza created history by scoring the fastest-ever century in T20I cricket on Wednesday. Zimbabwe skipper smashed a 33-ball hundred against Gambia in the T20 World Cup Qualifier game to break Rohit Sharma and David Miller's sensational record.

newsArray.title: ‚ÄòYou don‚Äôt pick players on social media‚Äô: Head coach Gautam Gambhir backs struggling KL Rahul ahead of second Test vs NZ
newsArray.description: KL Rahul's position in the Indian Test lineup remains uncertain after a loss to New Zealand, but head coach Gautam Gambhir has voiced continued support for him, despite competition from Sarfaraz Khan and a potential toss-up between Kuldeep Yadav and Washington Sundar for the playing XI.

newsArray.title: Zimbabwe Break World Record With Highest-Ever T20I Total, Sikandar Raza Stars With 33-Ball Century
creator: ABP News Bureau
newsArray.description: Zimbabwe shattered the world record as they created history by posting the highest T20I total in the history of cricket. Zimbabwe scored 344 runs in 20 overs for the loss of four wickets against Gambia in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup Sub Regional Africa Qualifier Group B, 2024 match at Ruaraka Sports Club Ground, Nairobi.Captain Sikandar Raza was at the centre Zimbabwe's record-breaking performance as he notched up an unbeaten 133 off just 43 balls. Raza hit 15 sixes and seven boundaries in his destructive innings. He acheived the century milestone in just 33 balls.List Of Highest Totals In T20Is1. Zimbabwe: 344/4 vs Gambia - 2024 2. Nepal: 314/3 vs Mongolia - 2023 3. India: 297/6 vs Bangladesh - 2024 4. Zimbabwe: 286/5 vs Seychelles - October 2024 5. Afghanistan: 278/3 vs Ireland - 2019 6. Czech Republic: 278/4 vs Turkey - 2019 7. Malaysia: 268/4 vs Thailand - 2023 8. England: 267/3 vs West Indies - 2023 9. Australia: 263/3 vs Sri Lanka - 2016 10. Sri Lanka: 260/6 vs Kenya - 2007 Sikandar Raza and company guide Zimbabwe to the highest T20I score (344/4) in the format.üáøüáº: Sikandar Raza (133*), Tadiwanashe Marumani (62)üá¨üá≤: Andre Jarju (2/53)Gambia need 345 runs from 120 balls to win. #T20AfricaMensWCQualifierB https://t.co/9N1wWsVBzT pic.twitter.com/NXFpIK6C6L‚Äî ICC Africa (@ICC_Africa_) October 23, 2024This is a developing news. More to follow.
